title: Schoonbaert helps Pistons past Natives
text:
Schoonbaert helps Pistons past Natives By: Uncredited 
Brandon native Bradley Schoonbaert scored one goal and set up another on Wednesday as the Steinbach Pistons topped the Neepawa Natives 6-1 in the Manitoba Junior Hockey League. 
Elsewhere, it was: Winnipeg Blues 5, Swan Valley Stampeders 2. 
In Neepawa, Luke Amsbaugh netted a pair of markers for the Pistons (7-4-0), while Tyler Penner chipped in with a goal and two assists. Roman Bengert stopped 38 shots in net. 
Reigan Buchanan broke up the shutout bid with a power-play goal with 1:26 left in regulation for Neepawa (5-8-0). Troy Pierce stopped 35 of the 41 shots he faced. 
Blues 5 Stampeders 2 
At Winnipeg, Gianlucca Esteves paced the Blues (5-5-3), who snapped a three-game losing skid, with a goal and an assist. Cody Ellingson and Tristan Langan replied for the Stampeders (3-8-1). 
Claeys dealt 
The OCN Blizzard have shipped goalie Brody Claeys of Ste. Rose du Lac to the Alberni Valley Bulldogs of the British Columbia Hockey League for 18-year-old defenceman Taylor Derynck. Claeys, 19, played four games with OCN this season and sported a 2.70 goals-against average and a .928 save percentage. 
Meanwhile, the Winkler Flyers have acquired goalie Connor Slipp from the Flin Flon Bombers for future considerations.
